title: (x) Atlantis - The Lost Empire - custom font {Mike Y}
content:
Hi all,   
   
Looking for some kind soul to identify this font for me.   
   
 ![Atlantis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150403064351im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/48576.jpg)   
   
Hope you can help!   
   
Thanks,   
   
Matt Atherton
author: purpleplanet

comments.content: The font is a custom one developed by Disney Artists. You used to be able to download the font according to [this article](http://web.archive.org/web/20150403064351/http:/www.mouseplanet.com/sue/sk010607.htm), but the link didn't work any more. I suspect it's still around somewhere on the Disney site.

Thanks Mike, I'll go take a look!   
   
As usual, a VERY quick and helpful response.   
   
Regards,   
   
Matt

Thanks Mike, I'll go take a look!   
   
As usual, a VERY quick and helpful response.   
   
Regards,   
   
Matt

The font is a custom one developed by Disney Artists. You used to be able to download the font according to [this article](http://web.archive.org/web/20150403064351/http:/www.mouseplanet.com/sue/sk010607.htm), but the link didn't work any more. I suspect it's still around somewhere on the Disney site.   
   
I'm not so sure that the font they were talking about is the one used for the movie title though, because there was also an Atlantean language and alphabet developed for the movie. It may be the font was the new [imagined alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150403064351/http:/www.omniglot.com/writing/atlantean.htm) of the Atlanteans.   
   
Something to amuse your friends with, I suppose. Sounds like the guy who invented Klingon, was the one who came up with Atlantean for the film.

Oops! I guess that first post worked after all. The Server is acting up again, because I got a message that my first attempt didn't make it, so I added more and re-posted. I hope that's not too confusing.   
   
I see Matt probably had the same problem.
It also looks like it was derived from Palatino. You could modify it to get the same look.
